p:
Under definitions 1, 2, and 3, the clade-based methods, we explore the tree from root to tips to verify if nested clades meet the clustering requirements. More specifically, we employ a depth-first algorithm,
Start exploration at the root node,
Check if the clade whose most recent common ancestor (MRCA) is the current node meets the cluster definition. If so, stop. If not, move down to the two immediate children nodes and for each of them, repeat the current step,
Stop exploration along any given path once a tip is reached.
